channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13729] Old hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit and lowerLimit properties are ignored if present
item.description: If hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit or lowerLimit are present we should use them instead of hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.size or hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.size.lower.limit respectively. The current implementation of HeapMemorySizeUtil.getGlobalMemStorePercent() and getGlobalMemStoreLowerMark() asumes that if the new properties are not defined then we should use the old configurations, however the new properties are defined in hbase-default.xml which makes the old configuration names useless and this has a direct impact when doing a rolling upgrade and hbase-site.xml hasn't been changed to handle the new property names exclusively.
item.summary: Old hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit and lowerLimit properties are ignored if present

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attached trivial patch that addresses this issue.

hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit has the same problem, we have hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.size.lower.limit defined in hbase-defaul.xml and we will return immediately in getGlobalMemStoreLowerMark() instead of using the lower limit if present.
New patch handles lowerLimit as expected, just swapping the order is enough.
Since this is an issue with a critical priority, any chance for a unit test? Would help prevent regression going firward

If both are present, we have to give 1st preference for the new config and if that is not present then only check for old. This is the way we use in other related cases also
Pls refer CompactionConfiguration


minFilesToCompact = Math.max(2, conf.getInt(HBASE_HSTORE_COMPACTION_MIN_KEY,

          /*old name*/ conf.getInt("hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold", 3)));

Sorry for the delay Anoop Sam John I think the easiest thing to do for now is to unset the values for the new properties on the hbase-default.xml in branch-1. At least that will give ops a simple transition and keep the memstore footprint as it was configured on 0.98. Otherwise, ops will have to add a intermediate step in rolling upgrades to upgrade the confs to use the new properties or undefine hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.size and hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.size.lower.limit and make them final.
BTW hbase.hstore.compaction.min is not defined in hbase-default.xml and is a good example of my last comment.

I'm still trying to find if there is anyï¿½ caveat by doing this, but seem that it works fine. For new deployments this will take the hardcoded defaults which are the same from hbase-default.xml, does that change sounds right for you Anoop Sam John?
Do you want to say why the values are empty in hbase-default.xml in the description text? If you don't, empty values looks strange. Otherwise, patch looks good to me.
Thanks stack, I have attached a new patch with your observation.

For new deployments this will take the hardcoded defaults which are the same from hbase-default.xml

Yes.. Good then..
+1. Thanks for the nice catch Esteban Gutierrez

BTW I was telling abt below example in hbase-default.xml


 <property>

    <name>hbase.hstore.compaction.min</name>

    <value>3</value>

    <description>The minimum number of StoreFiles which must be eligible for compaction before 

      compaction can run. The goal of tuning hbase.hstore.compaction.min is to avoid ending up with 

      too many tiny StoreFiles to compact. Setting this value to 2 would cause a minor compaction 

      each time you have two StoreFiles in a Store, and this is probably not appropriate. If you

      set this value too high, all the other values will need to be adjusted accordingly. For most 

      cases, the default value is appropriate. In previous versions of HBase, the parameter

      hbase.hstore.compaction.min was named hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold.</description>

  </property>



    <property>

    <name>hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold</name>

    <value>3</value>

    <description> If more than this number of StoreFiles exist in any one Store 

      (one StoreFile is written per flush of MemStore), a compaction is run to rewrite all 

      StoreFiles into a single StoreFile. Larger values delay compaction, but when compaction does

      occur, it takes longer to complete.</description>

  </property>

Also we need to make an agreement that when we can remove a deprecated config (like Java API).. We seems not at all removing the old deprecated configs. What do you say stack

Anoop Sam John the above example from hbase-default.xml is from master. Currently in branch-1 we don't have hbase.hstore.compaction.min in there. But we should remove hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold since is deprecated

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12737731/HBASE-13729.3.patch
against master branch at commit bb62d5b2e8db1677568723bb8d0d8ea4fd2c6f46.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12737731

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14293//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14293//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14293//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14293//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 on this patch. Will apply in morning unless objection.
Pushed to branch-1.0+ (FYI Enis Soztutar and Nick Dimiduk). Thanks for the patch Esteban Gutierrez

Closing this issue after 1.0.2 release.
